questions.question: A geographic Coordinate System includes: Angular units, Spheroid, Datum and Prime meridian.

explanations.a: Correct Answer. A geographic Coordinate System includes: Angular units, Spheroid, Datum and Prime meridian.
explanations.b: A geographic Coordinate System includes: Angular units, Spheroid, Datum and Prime meridian.

questions.question: A geographic coordinate system is a __reference system that locates points on the Earth's surface

explanations.a: Correcct Answer. A geographic coordinate system is a three-dimensional reference system that locates points on the Earth's surface.
explanations.b: A geographic coordinate system is a three-dimensional reference system.
explanations.c: A geographic coordinate system is a three-dimensional reference system.
explanations.d: A geographic coordinate system is a three-dimensional reference system.

explanations.a: Correct Answer. A spatial database is also known as a “geospatial database”, built to capture and store the points, lines, and areas of cartographic information that we refer to as spatial data.

questions.question: A projected coordinate system is a flat ____ representation of the Earth.

explanations.a: A projected coordinate system is a flat two dimension representation of the Earth. The latitude and longitude coordinates are converted to x, y coordinates on the flat projection.
explanations.b: Correct Answer. A projected coordinate system is a flat two dimension representation of the Earth. The latitude and longitude coordinates are converted to x, y coordinates on the flat projection.
explanations.c: A projected coordinate system is a flat two dimension representation of the Earth. The latitude and longitude coordinates are converted to x, y coordinates on the flat projection.
explanations.d: A projected coordinate system is a flat two dimension representation of the Earth. The latitude and longitude coordinates are converted to x, y coordinates on the flat projection.
